senses.sense_definition: The custom or practice in which a widow marries the brother of her deceased husband.

examples.text: The anthropologist explained how the <w>levirate</w> ensured the widow's security within the family structure.
In some ancient societies, the <w>levirate</w> was considered a duty to preserve the deceased man's lineage.

senses.sense_definition: Relating to a husband's brother or the custom of a widow marrying him.

examples.text: The tribe followed strict <w>levirate</w> customs regarding inheritance and marriage.
Scholars have studied <w>levirate</w> obligations in various historical cultures.
